Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Latest version is not present using the NuGet API" (#7866) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
@darmalovan commented on [Thu Mar 12 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9291)

## Details about Problem
 I'm seeing a discrepancy in getting the latest version of a package between the NuGet website and the NuGet API.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Going to the NuGet web site for the `EntityFrameworkCore.Relational` package https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Relational/
the latest version is `3.1.2`. 

2. Using the API https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration3/microsoft.entityframeworkcore.relational/index.json I am getting `3.1.1` as the latest version.

I tried also to use the api.nuget.org/v3/registration3-gz-semver2 endpoint without any luck.

The search web site says `3.1.2` is the latest version:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5316748/76555697-d50a7a00-64a0-11ea-8c79-01e7b5c367dc.png)

Would love for any advice here :)


---

@donnie-msft commented on [Thu Mar 12 2020](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9291#issuecomment-598385470)

Hi! I'm sending this over to the Server team to take a look.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "On nuget.org the versions of Microsoft.ChakraCore are incorrect when read from the APIs" (#7863) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
On nuget.org, the versions reported by the API differs from the versions reported by the web interface for Microsoft.ChakraCore

### To Reproduce
Using a browser, visit https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.ChakraCore/
You can see the latest version is 1.11.16 (confirmed)

Using curl, access the information about the library:
https://api.nuget.org/v3/registration3/microsoft.chakracore/index.json
You can see the latest version is 1.11.15

### Expected behavior
The versions reported from the web interface and the versions reported from the API are consistent.

### Screenshots
**WEB:**  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/186370/76203510-ac5b5980-61ee-11ea-8f31-46a98e23c270.png)

**API:**  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/186370/76203565-c72dce00-61ee-11ea-966a-571b9fc6272e.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Expose domain and diagnostics source in MEF container" (#7862) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This enables synchronous initialization (via the constructor) of the cookie compliance shim.
Also, move the refresh to the background so that initial start-up is not slowed down.

Fully lights up with https://nuget.visualstudio.com/NuGetMicrosoft/_git/NuGet.Shims/pullrequest/1342.
Related to https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/2980.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Bring the VSO output window to focus when necessary" (#9295) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "async" (#9294) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "async" (#9294) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "[CPVM] Lock file needs to get invalidated if central dependencies change. " (#9293) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

When a project is using Central Package Version management, changes in the central version should invalidate the lock file. The reason is the fact that any central version can be transitive for other direct dependency.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget allowed a CoreFx stable package to be published with non-stable dependencies" (#8827) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
In the GA release of .Net Core 3.0, we published the 4.6.0 version of `runtime.native.System.IO.Ports` to nuget.org, with non-stable dependencies: https://www.nuget.org/packages/runtime.native.System.IO.Ports/. There was a bug in CoreFx that caused us to produce these non-stable runtime packages, but it also should have been caught during `nuget pack`/`nuget publish`.

CC @ericstj

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Fix new SDK 3.0 and MacOS10.14 related issues" (#8429) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We locked SDK version 3.0 preview 7 for testing now. If we're going to ship with SDK 3.0 preview 9, we need to : 
1.We have some broken tests to fix when we need to test with SDK 3.0 preview 9.
2.MacOS on agent machine needs to upgrade.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet plug-in API fails when doing simultaneous restores" (#9292) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.5

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Execute parallel restores that require authentication or other plug-in
2. Restore some times fails with an error like:
```
Problem starting the plugin 'PATHTOPLUGIN'. The process cannot access the file '%LocalAppData%\NuGet\plugins-cache\2a163a4397322a32ccf62440e8b2c089004a49c0\9d08616bea28af0d943074cf5bb029f7a6ac7aaf.dat-new' because it is being used by another process.
```

I suspect that the plug-in caching mechanism does not currently support this kind of concurrency.

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Protocol/Plugins/PluginCacheEntry.cs

This was reported by an internal team that is doing restores in a very custom way.  We will probably just not use an auth plug-in for now to work around the issue.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PackageReference ungracefully handles duplicate Runtime Identifiers in csproj PackageReference " (#9290) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Specifically see: 

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/9ba90610a465d3c73921ba88b0e338b71a17fc72/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio/Projects/VsProjectAdapter.cs#L310-L313

Repro:
Create a csproj.dll PR project.
Manually edit the project and set:

```xml
<RuntimeIdentifier>win</RuntimeIdentifier>
<RuntimeIdentifiers>win</RuntimeIdentifiers>
```

And see an exception:
```cs
 System.ArgumentException: An item with the same key has already been added.
```

Validate the same experience with SDK based projects.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PackageREference restore experience on failure different across VS and command line " (#9289) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Specifically if a PackageReference version is a property and that property is not set. 
* On the commandline the customer will get NU1604 and a restore.
* In VS, the whole operation fails. 

Worth clarifying in both SDK and non-SDK cases.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org – Stage 1" (#42) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
## NuGet.org will temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 on February 26, 2020

We plan to temporarily remove support for TLS 1.0/1.1 across 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each, to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. If you discover that you are impacted and cannot identify a workaround, please open an issue on the NuGet Gallery GitHub repo.

Read this blog post to learn more and to identify the test slot time in your time zone - https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org-stage-1/
